channel.title: Jeollabuk-do on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Crystal of color and inlay technique, meets celadon ‘Buan celadon museum’ - Buan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
A view of the celadon museum with the original color of celadon

Crystal of color and inlay technique, meets celadon ‘Buan celadon museum’

Buan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

One of the best ceramics in the world is Goryeo celadon. Although celadon is from China, it has developed into an original Goryeo intestine that boasts a unique and beautiful color. Buan, Jeollabuk-do, along with Gangjin, Jeollanam-do, was the place where Goryeo celadon was in its heyday and was the best place to produce celadon. The Buan Celadon Museum, located in Yucheon-ri, where the garter remains, is a special space where you can meet Goryeo celadon more than 800 years ago.

Born into the home of Goryeo celadon, Buan celadon museum

Among the celadon lands in Korea, Gangjin, Jeollanam-do is famous enough to hold a celadon festival, and Buan, Jeollabuk-do, produced the best inlaid celadon as well.
Buan Celadon Museum opened in April 2011 (063-580-3964, www.buancela.go.kr ) Was formed in the former Yucheon Elementary School. The museum is decorated with celadon, so it's a good idea to look carefully. From the handle of the door made of celadon, to the glassy surface of celadon (a residual glass phenomenon caused by air contraction when baking glaze on porcelain), from the yellowish initial color of Goryeo celadon to the wall that produced the color of various celadon If you look, you can experience the mysterious world of celadon.

The Buan Celadon Museum consists of an exhibition hall, an experience building, and an outdoor historical park. The exhibition hall is divided into two floors. On the 1st floor, there was a celadon production room, a celadon experience room, and a special video room where you can watch 4D images. The second floor consisted of a celadon history room that clearly exhibited the history of celadon along with various celadon artifacts, and a luxury celadon room that can be immersed in the beautiful charm of inlaid celadon.

Visiting the celadon museum starts at the celadon history room on the 2nd floor and the luxury celadon room, and then goes around the 1st floor celadon production room and the experience room. However, in the special video room, there is a separate fee for admission to the Celadon Museum.

In the mug, pottery experience of family units or groups such as Goryeo celadon and porcelain tiles is also held 4 times a day (10:30, 1:30, 15:00, 16:30). Experience costs range from 10,000 won to 50,000 won. The artwork created through the experience is baked in a kiln and sent as a finished product (shipping fee is 4-6 weeks).

The entrance and wall of the museum expressing the color and balance of celadon

In the Goryeo Dynasty, Buan was the place with the optimum requirements for producing the best quality celadon. Quality soil and trees were abundant, and maritime transportation was developed to carry celadon. Known as a tattoo and heraldryer in the Goryeo Dynasty, Lee Kyu-bo was appointed as Buan's woodworking house to manage the trees to be used as a royal palace. It was where high-quality wood was produced. Since Goryeo celadon was mainly used by royal and central nobles, it carried Hongseong, Taean, and Ganghwa through the sea to Kaesong, and the starting point was near Anheungchang. Anheungchang was the place where Chochang was in the Goryeo Dynasty, and it is currently around Gomso Port, and it is very close to Yucheonri, a celadon land.

Celadon pattern stamp experience in celadon experience room

Cheongja Market in Buan remains in Yucheon-ri and Jinseo-ri, Jinseo-myeon. Over 70 kilns have been excavated so far. The first person to discover was a man named Nomori Ken, belonging to the Chosun Governor General in 1929. Since then, many Japanese people sneak Goryeo celadon and take it to their home countries, causing Goryeo celadon to suffer. The various celadon fragments and Koryo celadons that are now met at the museum are the ones purchased at Ewha Womans University after the liberation and the artifacts periodically purchased by the museum.

A kiln outside the celadon museum
Kingfisher feather color, celadon color meet, celadon history

The celadon history room was decorated with the history of ceramics. The history of pottery dates back to the Neolithic period. As the hunting mankind discovered the fire and settled in one place, the pottery's original 'bowl' was born. It is said that the birth of 'bowl', which is made using soil and fire, is an advanced technology to make a spacecraft. 'Bowl' continues to develop and shine as Goryeo celadon, the most beautiful in the world since the Goryeo Dynasty.

The history of Goryeo celadon began when the mayor of China fell to North Song, and the porcelain craftsmen of the mayor came into Goryeo. As the Goryeo Dynasty entered, demand for celadon from the ruling class also contributed. Although the beginning was the ceramic culture of China, it was established as a representative crafts with decorativeness and practicality throughout the Goryeo Dynasty. Later, as time passed, it became a unique celadon of Goryeo. This is because the color of celadon called color and the original inlay technique was created.

Hearing the history of pottery

Goryeo celadon has a unique color, not that of China. 'Rain' is a Chinese character using the kingfisher rain (翡), which is the color of the kingfisher's feathers. Looking at the photos of the kingfisher, there is a bluish energy, but it is difficult to define any color, but you can quickly see that it is a mysterious and subdued color. The head nods to the words "color is the color in a person's mind." During the Song Dynasty in China, Seogye praised the beauty of Goryeo celadon's sophistication and color in the book 《Sunhwa Volunteer Goryeo Dynasty》 written after coming to Korea as an envoy. The white porcelain is the best in Zhengzhou, but the celadon praised the color, saying, "The color of Goryeo is the best in the world."
In the celadon history room, you can look at the history of celadon at a glance. You can meet everything from practical works, such as the early Hamu-ri-gu cups, dishes, and kettles, to beautiful inlays with unique color and inlay techniques. The unfinished celadon and debris excavated from Yucheon-ri, the representative land of Buan, also remain intact as they continue to pass through the years.

Koryo celadon exhibited in celadon history room
Into the luxury inlay listeners, the luxury listener room and the celadon production room

The inlay technique was first invented by Goryeo potters. It refers to engraving the surface of the molded porcelain and scraping it with white clay and clay (red soil), and then baking it with glaze. In simple terms, it is a technique that digs out part of the raw material and fills in other materials on the spot to preserve the pattern. The Goryeo celadon is divided into the period of pure listeners and inlaid listeners based on the 12th century. If the 12th century was the age of pure listeners without any patterns or patterns, after the 12th century, it was the heyday of inclined listeners and inlaid listeners.

Celadon ornament made with inlay technique

In the celadon luxury room, you can see about 30 authentic inlays of various inlaid celadon during the period when celadon was in its heyday. The more you look at the lotus stem pattern hawk bottle, chrysanthemum pattern gourd-shaped kettle, peony and chrysanthemum pattern melon-shaped bottle, the more you fall in love with it. This is because there are other works of art hidden in the inlaid audience, such as beautiful flower patterns such as chrysanthemums and peonies, cranes flying in the clouds, and waterside scenery with water birds and trees.

Celadon inlaid melon-shaped bottle displayed in a luxury celadon room
The celadon section found in Yucheon-ri

Visiting the Cheongja Production Room on the 1st floor starts with seeing the deep waters of the Biando Sea. In 2002, more than 3,000 celadon crusts were discovered in the waters of Biando off the coast of Buan. At the entrance to the celadon production room, the appearance at the time of excavation is reproduced, and this is a space to infer the process from celadon production to transportation through the celadon transport ship that met and sank. Starting with the soil, defence, and soil, the entire process was reproduced, from molding to shape using a spinning wheel, glazing through intaglio and inlay, baking from the kiln, and inspection of finished products and packaging for shipping.

The process of excavating artifacts in the Biando waters
The figure engraved on the molded porcelain
The appearance of covering
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

West Coast Expressway Julpo IC → Turn left towards Byeonsan and Jeolpo → Turn right at the intersection of Cheonbaesan → Turn right at Byeonsan at Jeolpo Middle School → Turn left at Yeongjeon Intersection toward Byeonsan → Buan Cheongja Museum

* public transport

Seoul → Buan: 16 times a day (06: 50-19: 30) from Seoul Central City (02-6282-0114), takes 2 hours 50 minutes
Daejeon → Buan: 3 times a day (09: 20-18: 05) from Daejeon Complex Terminal (1577-2259), takes 2 hours 30 minutes
Gwangju → Buan: 5 times a day (09: 30-18: 25) from Gwangju Complex Terminal (062-360-8114), takes 1 hour 40 minutes
Busan → Buan: 20 buses (06: 10-21: 30) to Gwangju from Seobu Intercity Bus Terminal (1577-8301), takes 3 hours and 10 minutes. From Gwangju Multi-Terminal Bus to Buan
※ From Buan Intercity Bus Terminal, take bus No. 350 and No. 301 toward Sangseo, Naesosa, and get off at Yucheon Rest Area Bus Stop (operated 15 times a day)

2. Delicious

Sanchae: Gamgyo-ri, Sangseo-myeon / Sanchae Stone Pot Bibimbap / 063-584-0167
Kim In-kyung's Pants Rock Porridge: Byeonsan-myeon Daehang-ri / Mulberry Leaf Pants Rock Porridge / 063-583-9763 / www.바지락죽.com
Gyeokpo Restaurant: Gyeokpo-ri, Byeonsan-myeon / Blue crab restaurant / 063-583-5365
Gyehwa Hall: Haengan-myeon Singi-ri / Yuri-sik / 063-581-0333

3.Accommodation

Chaeseok Resorttel Oakville: Gyeonpo-ri, Byeonsan-myeon / 063-583-8046 / www.csr063.com
Humok Art Town: Unho-ri, Jinseo-myeon / 010-9998-8887 / www.hmarttown.com
Mohang Haenaru Family Hotel: Byeonsan-myeon Docheong-ri / 063-580-0700 / www.haenaruhotel.co.kr
Chaeseokgang Star Hills Hotel: Byeonsan-myeon Gappo-ri / 063-581-9911 / www.starhills.net

item.title: It is more delicious if you know and drink! Korea Sulthema Museum - Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Impressive exhibits at the Korea Sulma Museum

It is more delicious if you know and drink! Korea Sulthema Museum

Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

It is the end of the year when you drink more alcohol than usual. Some may like it, and some may not be able to afford it. Alcoholic beverages entertain people and comfort their minds, but sometimes they become poison and harm their health and relationships. For sake
Full-scale exhibitions are gathered in the first and second exhibition halls on the third floor. The 1st Exhibition Hall's chief artifact exhibition hall displays a selection of 50,000 artifacts that fit the theme. The old days used to make alcohol
The Korea Sulma Theme Museum opened in October 2015
The huge wooden pavilion in the middle of the exhibition hall is a mix of godubap or yeast when making cheonju or takju. There are plenty of things to see, such as the alcoholic beverages that were numbered to collect taxes during the Japanese colonial rule, and the alcoholic beverages that were used to carry alcohol.
It is full of valuable artifacts, centered on giant ships.
In the three-dimensional video theater next to the Sujanghyeong Artifacts Exhibition, you can watch the video of the story of Haemosu, who went to get the most delicious sake from the world to get the oil painting of Habaek, the daughter of the god of water, who loved drinking.
Early domestic wine
The Joseon Dynasty period was the dark age of alcohol
The second exhibition hall has an impressive entrance like a suldog. There are many interesting contents, including how to make sake based on ingredients, and the streets that reproduce the history and culture of Korean sake, traditional sake, and taverns of memories. During the Joseon Dynasty, this was often done to save grain. Alcohol was forbidden when there was a condition or severe drought caused a bad year. Yeongjo was especially strict with alcohol. It is said that Danjong (Gamju) was used instead during the rite of Jongmyo Shrine, and was ruled to be a death penalty when violating Geumjuryeong.
World alcohol and unique wine bottles
The street of memories that reproduced the tavern in the 1970s and 1990s actually reproduced the ompan house and Yongjin foundry in Jeonju. Thanks to the creation of food and people models in alleyways, street lamps, shops, chicken houses, hop houses, and stalls, memories are revived as if they were back in that time on a time machine. A museum specializing in alcohol is not only for adults. Children also have a lot of fun and fun to experience.
Ompanjip, a famous spot in Jeonju in the 1970s
The Hyangeum Culture Experience Hall, located at the innermost of the second exhibition hall, is a space for children. With the Chroma Key technique, when the spectator takes off his shoes and sits in front of the sake table prepared in front of the blue screen, the spectator can appear in the pre-recorded video and perform the ritual ritual in person. This is an experience where you can learn our traditions of inviting guests and serving alcohol. There are a variety of Gyeyeongbae experiences designed to keep the glasses full, rolling the main sphere, matching puzzles, and coloring.
Hyangeum Culture Experience Center with many experiences for children
Juryong-gu is a 14-sided dice with penalties written on each side, such as drinking 3 glasses at a time, drinking 1 poem, dancing without a song, and hitting the noses of several people. A glimpse into the drinking culture of the new lines
Juryu-gu with interesting penalties
Various experience programs
Tobacco Culture Planning Exhibition Hall, located next to the elevator on the first floor, is easy to miss. It is a place where tobacco, which can be said to be the best drink, can be seen in one place, from the first cigarettes in Korea to the world's famous cigarettes. Korea-Japan merger
Tobacco Culture Planning Exhibition Hall
Various educational experience programs are held in the basement experience room on the first basement level. It is good to enjoy the making of Juryong-gu, fermentation experience activity, making fermented bread, making cookies, and fermentation healing therapy. Adult programs include making rice wine, making house beer, making wine, and making cocktails. It is conducted when there are more than 5 people.
There are many experiences related to fermentation
Outside the building, there is a tasting room where you can taste sake for free. Around 10 kinds of alcohol are prepared, including wine and sake, which represent the region. Up to 3 drinks per person are possible.
Tasting room where you can taste sake for free
It introduces local sake that has been recognized for taste, and suspicious sake at national conventions. I don't have to worry about it because it's a small, one-size-sized cup of thumb.
Enjoy local sake and famous sake
Jeonbuk Provincial Museum of Art with the nest of art at the foot of Moaksan Mountain
When you arrive at the foot of the mountain to climb Moak Mountain, the cover of Jeonbuk Provincial Museum of Art comes before the cover of Moak Mountain. Moaksan was built behind his back, and the grilled reservoir was wrapped like a skirt, so the scenery was outstanding. It wasn't located in the city center, but it was a museum that nested in nature, so it wasn't because there were few visitors and it was cool. Oh, Mt.
Jeonbuk Provincial Museum of Art
On weekends, experience programs for children are held. Programs such as making and decorating are conducted free of charge, and participation is available on a first-come, first-served basis.
Inside a spacious and cool structure
Travel information

Korea Sulthema Museum
-Address: 232-58, Deokcheonjeon-gil, Gu-myeon, Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do
-Inquiries: 063-290-3842

http://www.sulmuseum.kr/index.9is

Jeonbuk Provincial Museum
-Address: 111-6, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do
-Inquiries: 063-290-6888

http://www.jma.go.kr/korean/


Restaurants near
-Happy stop: Local food Korean buffet / 95, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun / 063-253-5761
http://blog.naver.com/wjlocalfood

-Sambaekjip: Bean sprout soup / 22, Jeonju guesthouse 2-gil, Wansan-gu, Jeonju-si / 063-284-2227
http://www.300zip.com/

-Rock Lak Noodle: Noodles / 366 Gyeonpyeon-ro, Deokjin-gu, Jeonju-si / 063-247-0082

http://blog.naver.com/rakrak2015

Rooms

item.title: Romantic lights embroidering the autumn night, fox lights in the mountains of Wanju - Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Fox in the mountains embroidering the autumn night

Romantic lights embroidering the autumn night, fox lights in the mountains of Wanju

Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

There is a light festival with the theme of the novel The Little Prince. The entire Wanju Hiljo Town nestled in Bongsil Mountain in Bibong-myeon, Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do turns into a romantic light festival in the evening. During the day, you can walk through the herb garden and fresh forests, and experience activities such as dirt play for children and Indian tents. Shall we go for a night walk while listening to the story of the fox?
There is no fox in the mountains, no fox.
The fox color appeared in Wanju. Old people said that when they encounter strange lights in a field or in a forest, they say it is a goblin or fox fire.
Come play fox in the mountains
The modern version of the goblin with LED bulbs on trees or sculptures can be enjoyed regardless of the weather because there is no risk of electric shock even in the event of snow or rain.
LED embroidered lights
Thanks to the fox in the novel 《The Little Prince》, the name ‘San Fox in the Mountains’ was added to the light festival that colored the night. It is a setting in which the fox who meets again in the dream of the little prince tells a story about him.
The story of “The Little Prince” is installed all over the place.
That doesn't mean that there are fox or young prince sculptures. The storyboards are installed everywhere with pictures. If you don't pay attention to the story board, you don't have to install any lights. There are also impressive passages from the novel, and advice to cherish this time. There is no fox, but you can enjoy the beautiful fox color by recalling the scene in the novel.
Purple gujeolcho blooming in autumn
Romantic indian tent
The festival hall can be considered as a large garden on a sloping mountain. There is a parking lot at the bottom, and when you climb the stairs, you will see a fox shelter selling ticket counters and snack streets.
Moonlight garden full of flowers and herbs
After passing the entrance with the welcome sign next to the ticket office, the road leads to the letter S, and the Moonlight Garden, Wind Garden, Media Art (Performance Hall), Rose Garden of the Little Prince, Mark Brown Cafe, Foxlight Glamping Site, Stone Tower Square, and Jabau Hwadukgui Restaurant Comes out. It is convenient to go to the top and then slowly descend and watch.
The moonlight garden is lit.
If you visit the fox school next to the ticket office during the day, you can experience various things. The ‘no-litter in and out’ using pottery pottery soil is a space where you can freely crush the earthen dough.
The rose that just lit up
The entrance time is set at 11, 2, and 4, so you can enjoy the experience only by going in time. You must bring your own clothes. If you make a reservation, you can also experience making a craftsman, a mensa game, and making a natural product.
month
The Fox Glamping Site, named Apios Village, has an Indian tent in the form of a cow hat. It is said that the Indian tent in the movie <Dancing with the Wolf> was reproduced and made by hand. It can sleep 4 to 6 people. It cannot be cooked inside, and breakfast and dinner are sold in a package provided by the restaurant.
Afios Village with Indian tent
When the lights come on, the romantic atmosphere is full. Sitting on a chair on the deck and looking down, the lights illuminate the mountain. It is a pity that the smell of the inside does not come off easily due to the structure of the tent.
Sit on a camping chair and enjoy the view
The rose garden where the little prince will fall in love
Beneath the camping grounds is Cafe Brown, where you can relax while drinking coffee and tea. Performances are held every Saturday evening on the stage underneath. The contents of the performance are different every time. Mostly, there are stages for amateur singers and bands active in the region as music performances. Sometimes the surprise proposals of lovers are held before or after the performance. If you are a couple considering a special event, please take courage to apply.
Girls in the rose garden
If you follow the rosy side of the theater, you will see the rose garden. It is a fantastic place with tens of thousands of roses in full bloom. Compared to other light festivals, the overall lighting decoration is rather modest, but thanks to the rose garden here, it is more impressive. Roses are not flowers, but harmony. A wire was connected to the stem to make the buds light up. At first glance, there are quite a few who are trying to break it because it is like a flower. It looks more plausible because it has two buds and a blooming rose. Roses that glow white, yellow, or pink spread out like a carpet and are beautiful.
A rose like a carpet
It looks pretty, but it is difficult to capture the feeling with a cell phone camera. To capture the romantic atmosphere, it is important not to use the flash, but to shoot as steady as possible.
A wind garden with a nice pine tree decoration
Beneath the rose garden is a moonlight garden full of herbs and flowers and a wind garden with colorful lights wrapped around trees. Moonlight Garden is better to see when there is sunlight before it gets dark. Flowers bloom every season, and various kinds of herbs are planted to make them fragrant. Fox lights in the mountains are open all year round, and the summer season (May-October) lights up at 6 PM and can be seen until 12 PM (last admission at 11:00). During the winter season (November-April), lighting is faster by 1 hour, and is available from 5 PM to 12 PM (last admission is 11 PM).
Wind Garden Rose
A bowl of noodles on the way to the light festival
Even if time is early on the way to the fox in the mountains, it is good to eat dinner beforehand. This is because there is only one restaurant in the festival hall and only a few snacks. It is a 15-minute drive from Bongdong-eup to Hiljo Town, so it is perfect to eat at Bongdong. Located on the other side of the Bongdong Nonghyup, “The Three Grandmothers Noodle Collection” is a place that has delighted people with delicious noodles for over 60 years.
Foxbit Shelter's Main Beak
There is only one menu, noodles. This is done by adding noodles to the broth, which has a deep rich taste and a refreshing taste, and sprinkle with red pepper powder on the onion. There is no common Zidane or Cucumber, but the chopsticks are delicious enough to be busy. Quickly empty a bowl and make the soup clean even though it is full of pears. It is very simple to put on top of noodles such as kimchi, kkakdugi, cheonyang pepper, and sweet radish. It is divided into large / medium / small depending on the quantity, and the price is also low at 5,000 won / 4,000 won / 3,500 won each. If you order ‘Medium’ for an adult male or ‘Small’ for a female, it is a quantity that can be left slightly due to the stomach. It's not splendid, but it's not special, but it has many long-standing regulars and a lot of people who come and eat it on purpose.
Three grandmother's noodle shops loved with consistent taste
Travel information

Wanju Hiljo Town
Address: 235-38, Cheonho-ro, Bibong-myeon, Wanju-gun, Jeonbuk
Contact: 1899-5852

http://www.healjo.co.kr/


1.Nearby Restaurants

Three Grandmother Noodle Collection: Noodles / 135 Bongdong-dongseo-ro, Bongdong-eup, Wanju-gun / 063-261-2312
New Charm Float: Slow Food Buffet / 11 Bongdong-dongseo-ro, Bongdong-eup, Wanju-gun / 063-261-4276
Ahara: Vegetarian table setting / 854-7, Gosancheon-ro, Gosan-myeon, Wanju-gun / 063-263-3880

2.Accommodation

Moaksan Motel: 104-10, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun / 063-222-2023
With You Hotel: 105 Bongdong-ro, Bongdong-eup, Wanju-gun / 063-261-8088
Happy Dream Hanok: 181-21 Bongseoan-gil, Yongjin-myeon, Wanju-gun / 063-247-0050

http://cafe.daum.net/happybongse

item.title: You're perfect except for the expensive one, your name is blue crab - Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Rice thief soy sauce crab. Right in season, the eggs are full

You're perfect except for the expensive one, your name is blue crab

Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

There is a food that reminds me of the proverb, ‘Even if two people die while eating, they do n’t know.’ If you are on a diet, you should never get close to the rice thief crab. The soy sauce crab sauce can taste the sweet and sour blue crab flesh like 'sashi', and the seasoned crab sauce has a spicy and sweet seasoning and vegetables. In this prosperous season, I visited the blue crab in season.

What comes to mind when you say ‘Gunsan’? Seonyudo Island of Gogunsan Islands? Where Jeolla-do's hearty table starts? Let's take a look at the map for a while. Crossing the stem of Geum River in Seocheon, South Chungcheong Province, the land of Jeolla Province begins. Gunsan is at the starting point. After Gunsan, Gimje and Buan to the south, and Iksan and Jeonju to the east. It is a town that has both the West Sea tidal flats and the Honam plains on both sides. A rich land with fresh water, salt water, and even plains. In addition, it bears the stems of the West Sea and the Geum River, which is advantageous for transportation in and out of the Korean Peninsula. The stem of the Geum River, which separates the boundary between Gunsan and Seocheon, digs deep into the West Sea from the outside to Ganggyeong, Chungnam, and carries it in one body with the sea.
This land, which had a natural environment of warmth, was unable to escape the Japanese occupation. The invaders could not know the advantages of Gunsan, which is good for transportation while also providing abundant food in water and water. In the 21st century, it is also the reason why we can make a “modern cultural history trip” just by looking around Gunsan properly. How can heal wounds stuffed with the name 'history'?

A taste tour of seasonal crabs in the West Sea
I looked at the overall atmosphere of Gunsan. Today's trip to Gunsan is a very delicious 'blue crab trip'. That they don't know if one dies while they eat! The slender young lady is the main protagonist of the rice thief, who eats two bowls of rice. However, there are so many stories that Gunsan had to just come to eat, so it's a pity to eat crab crab and stop by the Iseongdang bakery.
Gunsan Blue Crab Shop <Great> Blue Crab Hansang
Where is that? Thanks to its rich environment, Gunsan has many delicacies. From Korea's oldest bakery <Lee Seongdang> to <Bokseongru>, one of the nation's top five champons, to <Gunsan Sashimi House>, which has the rumor that it boasts the largest scale in Asia. Aside from the crab shop, there are plenty of restaurants and bakeries across the country. In addition, powerful restaurants such as <Daega>, <Gyeok Garden>, and <Han Joo-ok>, famous for their crab dishes, are added. Although not as “touristized” as Jeonju in the neighboring neighborhood, Gunsan here is a taste that can not be missed by gourmets.
The outfit begins with a gentle porridge
On the way to meet today's protagonist Crab, I suddenly wonder. Why is it Gunsan? Blue crabs in most parts of the West Sea. But why is the poisonous Gunsan crab crab famous? Let's find out from the beginning of the crab crab.
Soy crab without words
As we know, there are many blue crabs on the west coast. The East Sea is usually snow crab, and the West Sea is blue crab. As the name suggests, crabs are not as hard as shellfish (salt crab), and they are less expensive than snow crabs, so you can enjoy them freely. That doesn't mean the taste is falling, so I think there is more filial piety for fishermen.
Crab crab's double-headed wagon spicy and sweet seasoned crab
However, there were many difficulties in storing blue crabs. Live crabs eat my flesh over time. Now, when the technology has developed, it is only necessary to freeze and store fresh blue crabs with 'rapid freezing', but where would that be? It is in the same context as the development of chopped salt in a hard land located inland inside the stem of Geumgang.
Soy Crab
Fishermen who had to keep blue crabs for a long time thought of salting. Initially, the crab intestines were removed and salted. The purpose was to keep the crab for a long time without damaging it. However, like this salted blue crab, it can be stored for a long time without being damaged, but it is too salty. The blue crab has a light but salty taste.
Seasoned crab crab
“How can I keep the crab crab for a long time while preserving it?”
Seasoned crab crab rice is also honey-flavored
From this worries, soy sauce crabs were born for the whole country. As the crab was pickled in soy sauce, the preservation period was extended, and the harmony between the soy sauce and the crab meat was good. How happy it was to make the first soy sauce crab.
Soy Crab
There are a lot of hands to make soy crab, but it's surprisingly simple. First, fresh crab is essential. The taste of soy crab is determined by the freshness of ‘flower crab’.
Seasoned crab marinated with various vegetables and red pepper powder
Add fresh green crab, green onion, garlic, ginger, etc., and simmer the boiled soy sauce. Pour blue crab until it is completely immersed so that the sauce is evenly seasoned. Then, if you want to learn how much soy sauce is seasoned with crab meat, pour the soy sauce, boil the soy sauce again, cool it and pour it. Soy sauce crab is the process by which it is made.
The hard part of the blue crab legs is cut out for easy eating.
Repeating this three times is called 'Sambeoljang'. Gunsan Blue Crab is famous for its Sambaljang.
One bowl is just hot by rubbing it on the crab.
A bowl of rice fills up with fresh blue crab meat!
Delicious blue crab, where to taste it? <Daega> and <Gyeok Garden>, located on Geumgang-ro, in Amyeon-myeon, Gunsan, are conveniently located next door. You can enjoy not only crab crabs, but also crab crabs and steamed crabs. It's usually good to go around at 9pm, so it's better to go leisurely. Arrive after a little over 8 pm It's the tip of someone who has experienced turning around at the door, so remember.
Blue crab crab with agu steamed on the blue crab paste
And when you taste crab dishes, it is more advantageous if several people find it. This is because you can taste both crab soy sauce and seasoned crab sauce, as well as a variety of crab dishes, such as steamed crab and main dishes such as crab crab. No matter how greedy you are, it is a little difficult to taste crab dishes among travelers and lovers alone. It's the best fall family meal trip. Delicious but far-flung crab crabs are quite expensive.
Sashimi from both blue crab and white meal
The blue crab alum of <Han Joo-ok> is also indispensable. Soy sauce, seasoned blue crab, sashimi, and fish soup are similar when you think of a hoejeongsik. When agu jjim is added to this, the crab crab is set. Boiled fish and grilled Bakdae are also added. Just think of the hearty shape of Namdo Island.
<Han Joo-ok> Soy crab
The Namdang Port Daeha Festival, Hongwon Port Natural Fish Crab Festival, and Anmyeondo White Sand Beach Festival are held from early September to the end of October. How about going on a delicious Gunsan Blue Crab trip with an exciting festival?
Seasoned crab
Travel information

Restaurants near

-Valley Garden: 470 Geumgang-ro, Revised-myeon, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do / 063-453-0608

http://www.crabland.com/

-Price: 466 Geumgang-ro, Ajeong-myeon, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do / 063-453-0831

-Han Ok-ok: 31, Guyeong 2-gil, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do / 063-443-3812

Rooms

-Apple Tree Hotel Gunsan: 17 Gadoan 1-gil, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do / 063-734-1234

-Best Western Gunsan Hotel: 435 Saemangeumbuk-ro, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do / 063-469-1234

http://www.gunsanhotel.co.kr/

-Provence: 9, Gado 2-gil, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do / 063-467-2100

item.title: 'Cherry Blossom Ending' is on the way to Topsa, and Maisan Cherry Blossom Road - Jinan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Maisan Cherry Blossom Road is filled with spring mood

'Cherry Blossom Ending' is on the way to Topsa, and Maisan Cherry Blossom Road

Jinan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

I missed the peak of spring flowers, is it just swallowing the sadness? Jinan Mai Mountain is located on a plateau, where cherry blossoms bloom until late. It is a bulwark of cherry blossom viewing. The shading of Maisan reflected in the Top Youngje Reservoir and the rare stone tower of Topsa serve as a “travel insurance” even after flowering. If you take a walk at Jinan Red Ginseng Spa or Baekwoon Village Village, it is a springtime destination regardless of flowers.
When the flowers bloom in Yunjung-ro, Maisan blooms
Spring flowers are in full bloom in April. It is a good time to go to the mountains. There are many cherry blossom paths. It blooms brightly and abundantly with springtime
The Maisan Cherry Blossom Road is about 2.5km from the tomb of Isan to Topsa. Maisan cherry trees are 20-30 years old and are not large or thick. However, the road toward Sansa adds a sense of luck. It shines in harmony with the surrounding nature. The slope to the top temple is gentle, so walk slowly and cherry blossoms
Maisan Cherry Blossom Road is perfect for walking
Top Youngje, decal comani of spring day
From the road leading to the southern parking lot in Maisan, the streets of cherry blossoms make you feel the peak of spring. When you get off the parking lot, move towards the tower. A quiet cherry blossom path opens.
Restaurants are located at the entrance of Maisan Cherry Blossom Road
The first part is a restaurant around the ticket office. There are many foods in Jinan such as fried ginseng or black pork. It is a place to stop by and enjoy entertainment. It is not easy to overlook if you are hungry.
Representative menu of the cherry blossom road entrance Grilled black pork of Jinan
The nature of cherry blossoms in nature grows as they pass through the Golden Temple. It's the last cherry blossom, so there aren't many late spring visitors, but somewhere in the spring. Nevertheless, the pink cherry blossom branches hanging along the roadside are a constant excitement.
Cherry blossoms blooming in front of the Golden Temple
The essence is Top Youngje Reservoir. It makes Maisan cherry blossoms famous regardless of time. Cherry blossoms along the side of the reservoir
Cherry Blossom Road Bench at Top Youngje Reservoir
If it is a late spring flower outing, the reflection of the young Maisan in the Topyeongje Reservoir will soothe the sadness. Ammaibong and the green of the cherry tree that just sprouted cast a soft shadow on the water.
Reflection of young cherry blossom path and Ammaibong of Topyeongje Reservoir
Decalcomani of Mother Nature is a painting and art. It is a view with elasticity. If you sit still on the bank, it is full of spring energy.
The reflection of Maisan on the waterside is a spring day.
Classic boating is also tempting. It is a duck boat going up and down the water. If you are a lover, you are encouraged to enjoy the scenery of spring on the water.
Duck riding adds classic romance
If you hang over the edge of the cherry blossoms, the petals will fly like snowflake on the water, giving you a romantic moment.
Cherry blossoms blend in the reservoir landscape at sunset
Looking for a springtime spa or “signboard”
The stone tower experience area passes as well as a trip to Topyeongje and goes to Topsa Temple. You can stop walking and build a stone tower. If you are with a family member or a lover, you may wish to add a light wish.
Green and pink cherry blossoms harmonize and decorate spring
Cherry blossoms hang over the rustic stone tower. And when the last cherry blossoms disappear, Pagoda Temple is revealed. Top Temple also acts as an 'insurance' for late flower viewing. Maisan is a must-visit destination with a panoramic view of the tower.
Pagoda's towers are mysterious at any time, regardless of season.
As the name suggests, Pagoda is surrounded by huge towers. These are the 80 stone towers built by Gap-ryong Lee. Among them, Cheonji Tower, Moonlight Tower, and Yaksa Tower are famous. In this, it contained the rationale of the microcosm of Yin and Yang. Most of all, it is mysterious that it has not collapsed in the typhoon for over 100 years. Walk in between and climb to the top pair of heaven and earth. From the back of Cheonji Pagoda
Stacking stones at the Stone Tower Experience Center is also a small pleasure.
After visiting Pagoda Temple, you can pass through Eunsu Temple and Emperor Gate to descend to the northern parking lot. It is also recommended to enjoy the mountain hike in person. Starting from the southern parking lot, climb to Gogeumdang, Observatory, and Bongdubong, then descend to Topsa, or from the observation deck to the northern parking lot, the course takes 2 to 2 hours and 30 minutes. It is a road full of fresh green in springtime.
Cheonji Tower from the top of Pagoda Temple and surrounding mountains
After visiting the cherry blossoms of Maisan or going on a mountain hike in spring, you can make a trip to Jinan Red Ginseng Spa. Jinan is famous for ginseng, but red ginseng spa is a famous place to experience its efficacy.
Open-air hot spring at Jinan Red Ginseng Spa
Jinan Red Ginseng Spa is largely divided into Taiji Zone, Therapy Zone, and Aqua Zone. The Taegeuk Zone, which is a massage method with red ginseng foam, is the special treatment for the Taegeuk Bubble Sense Therapy and the Aqua Zone open-air bath while enjoying the view of Maisan Mountain. You can also spend a day in Jinanville, a lodging facility, and travel to Jinan.
Representative spa facility Taegeuk Bubble Sense Therapy <Photo courtesy, Jinan Red Ginseng Spa>
If you plan on staying 1 night, Baekwoonwon Village is also recommended. It is located in Baekwoon-myeon, about 10km south of Mt.
Interesting patterns in Baekwoonwon Village
It is the most 'good sign' village in the country. Mural villages are the mainstream for the village decorating project, but Wonchon Village maintained village signs in 2007. Uniquely shaped signs add to the fun of walking around town. It goes well with the rustic scenery of a rural village.
The spirit of a rural village will make you feel relaxed.
Travel info

Maisan Provincial Park

-Address: 182 Maisannam-ro, Maeryeong-myeon, Jinan-gun, Jeonbuk (South Tourist Information Center, Maisan)

-Inquiries: 063-430-2651 (Mysan Southern Tourist Information Center)

http://maisan.jinan.go.kr/


Mysan Topsa

-Address: 367, Maisannam-ro, Maryeong-myeon, Jinan-gun, Jeonbuk

-Inquiries: 063-433-0012

http://maisan.jinan.go.kr/home/maisan/seeing/tapsa/tapsa_02


Jinan Red Ginseng Spa

-Address: 16-10, Oejeongsan-gil, Jinan-eup, Jinan-gun, Jeonbuk

-Inquiries: 1588-7597

http://www.redginsengspa.co.kr/


Restaurants near

-Chogajeongdam: Black Pig / 213, Maisannam-ro, Maryeong-myeon, Jinan-gun / 063-432-2469

-Samjingak: Chinese cuisine / 1323 Imjin-ro, Baekun-myeon, Jinan-gun / 063-433-4945


Rooms

-Jinan Red Ginseng Spa (Hotel Red Ginsengville): 16-10, Oejeongsan-gil, Jinan-eup, Jinan-gun / 063-433-0396

-Unjangsan Natural Recreation Forest: 77, Recreation Forest Road, Jeongcheon-myeon, Jinan-gun / 063-432-1193

http://www.huyang.go.kr/main.action
